Class Register

  • java.lang.Object
    • Register

  • public class Register
extends java.lang.Object
    A class dedicated to the inner operations of the cash register, and storing it's values of currency inside a private array, alongside their titles and cent representation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[] currencyArray 
      (package private) java.util.Scanner input 
      private int[] multiplyArray 
      private int totalCents 
      private java.lang.String[] valueTitleArray 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Register()
      Initializes values in cents for each of the cash units at random (0x-15x).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] askForCents()
      Asks the user how many units of currency they would like for each unit type.

      Converts a given integer as a properly formatted string.
      void chargeCustomer(int centsCharged)
      Guides the register operator through charging a customer by utilizing askForCents(), and deciding if their requested transaction is possible.
      void manualTransaction(boolean pos, int[] requestedCents)
      Handles the processing of transactions by changing the register currency array, and total cents held.
      private void printOwedArray(int[] owedArray)
      Prints all the cash values of an owed change array given in parameters.
      void printTotals()
      Prints all cash values by iterating through the private register currencyArray

    • Constructor Detail

      • Register

        public Register()
        Initializes values in cents for each of the cash units at random (0x-15x).

    • Method Detail

      • printTotals

        public void printTotals()
        Prints all cash values by iterating through the private register currencyArray

      • printOwedArray

        private void printOwedArray(int[] owedArray)
        Prints all the cash values of an owed change array given in parameters.
        Parameters:
        owedArray - an array of cents organized by value type to return to the customer

      • centsAsString

        private java.lang.String centsAsString(int cents)
        Converts a given integer as a properly formatted string.
        Parameters:
        cents - integer amount of cents that a currency represents in the register.
        Returns:
        a formatted dollar amount string as interpretation of given cents.

      • chargeCustomer

        public void chargeCustomer(int centsCharged)
        Guides the register operator through charging a customer by utilizing askForCents(), and deciding if their requested transaction is possible. If possible, this method then edits the register currency values accordingly.
        Parameters:
        centsCharged - represents the cost of the item that the customer is buying. Used to calculated the cents owed in change.

      • manualTransaction

        public void manualTransaction(boolean pos,
                              int[] requestedCents)
        Handles the processing of transactions by changing the register currency array, and total cents held.
        Parameters:
        pos - a boolean representing if the transaction is positive or negative.
        requestedCents - An integer array that represents each currency unit, and the quantity of that unit involved in the transaction.

      • askForCents

        public int[] askForCents()
        Asks the user how many units of currency they would like for each unit type. It validates that each unit is a positive int.
        Returns:
        an array of how much of each unit the user is interacting with, with the last value of the array saved for a cent total across all units.
